intro: Anodontea meniocoides, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark wood and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and is known for its ornamental value. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to overharvesting, it is now considered endangered and is protected in many regions.
